lines.value: अफ्रिकन युनियन अंग्रेजीइ au मेमेगु आधिकारिक भाषाय् ua छगू अन्तरसरकारी संस्था ख। थ्व संस्थाय् अफ्रिकाया ५२गु सार्वभौम राष्ट्र सदस्य दु। जुलाई ९ सन् २००२ खुनु न्ह्यथंगु थ्व संस्था अर्गेनाइजेसन अफ अफ्रिकन युनिटीया उत्तराधिकारी ख। थ्व संघया दक्ले महत्त्वपूर्ण निर्णय असेम्ब्लीं कायेगु या। असेम्ब्लीया बैठक खुलाय् छकः देय्‌तेगु राष्ट्राध्यक्ष व सरकारया नायःतेगु दथुइ जुइ। संघया सेक्रेटेरियट अफ्रिकन युनियन कमिसनया ज्याकुथि अदिस अबाबा इथियोपियाय् दु। फेब्रुवरी २००९या युनियनया बैठक लिब्याया नेता गदाफीया नेतृत्त्वय् जुल। थ्व सम्मेलनय् अफ्रिकन युनियन कमिसनयात अफ्रिकन युनियन अथोरिटी दयेकिगु निर्णय जुल।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: thumbnail|right|map of the african union with suspended states highlighted in light green
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: <div style="font-size:95%;">
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union has a number of official bodies ; human rights : the african commission on human and peoples rights in existence since 1986 is established under the african charter on human and peoples rights the african charter rather than the constitutive act of the african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is the premier african human rights body with responsibility for monitoring and promoting compliance with the african charter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african court on human and peoples rights was established in 2006 to supplement the work of the commission following the entry into force of a protocol to the african charter providing for its creation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is planned that the african court on human and peoples rights will be merged with the african court of justice see above
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the constitutive act of the au declares that it shall invite and encourage the full participation of the african diaspora as an important part of our continent in the building of the african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union government has defined the african diaspora as consisting of people of african origin living outside the continent irrespective of their citizenship and nationality and who are willing to contribute to the development of the continent and the building of the african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in response to the death of gnassingbe eyadema president of togo on 5 february 2005 au leaders described the naming of his son faure gnassingbe the successor as a military coup
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: togo's constitution calls for the speaker of parliament to succeed the president in the event of his death
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by law the parliament speaker must call national elections to choose a new president within sixty days
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the au's protest forced gnassingbe to hold elections
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: under heavy allegations of election fraud he was officially elected president on 4 may 2005
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on 3 august 2005 a coup in mauritania led the african union to suspend the country from all organisational activities
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the military council that took control of mauritania promised to hold elections within two years
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these were held in early 2007 the first time that the country had held elections that were generally agreed to be of an acceptable standard
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: following the elections mauritania's membership of the au was restored
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however on 6 august 2008 a fresh coup overthrew the government elected in 2007
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the au once again suspended mauritania from the continental body
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: one of the objectives of the au is to promote peace security and stability on the continent
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: among its principles is peaceful resolution of conflicts among member states of the union through such appropriate means as may be decided upon by the assembly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the primary body charged with implementing these objectives and principles is the peace and security council
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the psc has the power among other things to authorise peace support missions to impose sanctions in case of unconstitutional change of government and to take initiatives and action it deems appropriate in response to potential or actual conflicts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the psc is a decision making body in its own right and its decisions are binding on member states
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: article 4(h of the constitutive act repeated in article 4 of the protocol to the constitutive act on the psc also recognises the right of the union to intervene in member state in circumstances of war crimes genocide and crimes against humanity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: any decision to intervene in a member state under article 4 of the constitutive act will be made by the assembly on the recommendation of the psc
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: since it first met in 2004 the psc has been active in relation to the crises in darfur comoros somalia democratic republic of congo burundi cote d'ivoire and other countries
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it has adopted resolutions creating the au peacekeeping operations in somalia and darfur and imposing sanctions against persons undermining peace and security such as travel bans and asset freezes against the leaders of the rebellion in comoros
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the council is in the process of overseeing the establishment of a standby force to serve as a permanent african peacekeeping force
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in response to the ongoing darfur conflict in sudan the au has deployed 7000 peacekeepers many from rwanda and nigeria to darfur
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while a donor's conference in addis ababa in 2005 helped raise funds to sustain the peacekeepers through that year and into 2006 in july 2006 the au said it would pull out at the end of september when its mandate expires
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: critics of the au peacekeepers including dr eric reeves have said these forces are largely ineffective due to lack of funds personnel and expertise
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: monitoring an area roughly the size of france has made it even more difficult to sustain an effective mission
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in june 2006 the united states congress appropriated us$173 million for the au force
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some such as the genocide intervention network have called for united nations un or nato intervention to augment and or replace the au peacekeepers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the un has considered deploying a force though it would not likely enter the country until at least october 2007
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the underfunded and badly equipped au mission was set to expire on december 31 2006 but was extended to june 30 2007 and will merge with the united nations african union mission in darfur
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in july 2009 the african union ceased cooperation with the international criminal court refusing to recognize the international arrest warrant it had issued against sudan's leader omar al bashir who was indicted in 2008 for war crimes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: from the early 1990s up until recently somalia was without a functioning central government
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a peace agreement aimed at ending the civil war that broke out following the collapse of the siad barre regime was signed in 2006 after many years of peace talks
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however the new government was almost immediately threatened by further violence
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to temporarily shore up the government's military base starting in march 2007 au soldiers began arriving in mogadishu as part of a peacekeeping force that was intended by the au to eventually be 8000 strong
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: mohamed bacar who had led the separatist government since 2001 was elected for a five year term as president of anjouan
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: his term expired the 14 april 2007 and the president of the assembly houmadi caambi became acting president from 15 april 2007 to 10 may 2007
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: citing irregularities and intimidation in the run up to voting the african union au and the union government postponed the polls on anjouan but a defiant island president mohamed bacar printed his own ballots held elections anyway and claimed a landslide victory of 90 percent on 11 may 2007
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in october 2007 the african union imposed travel sanctions on anjouan's president mohamed bacar and other government officials and froze their foreign assets while calling for fresh elections
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: additionally a naval blockade of the island was implemented
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in february 2008 the comoros rejected the african union's extended sanctions against anjouan and instead opted for a military solution
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in march 2008 hundreds of union government troops began assembling on moheli which is closer to anjouan than the larger island grande comore
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: sudan and senegal were expected to provide a total of 750 troops while libya has offered logistical support for the operation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition 500 tanzanian troops were due to arrive soon after
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the forces invaded anjouan on 25 march 2008
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the combined states of the african union constitute the world's 17th largest economy with a nominal gdp of $500 billion ranking after the netherlands
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by measuring gdp by ppp the african union's economy totals $1.515 trillion ranking it 11th after brazil
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at the same time they have a combined total debt of $200 billion
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the au future confederation's goals include the creation of a free trade area a customs union a single market a central bank and a common currency see african monetary union thereby establishing economic and monetary union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the current plan is to establish an african economic community with a single currency by 2023
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to the constitutive act of the african union its working languages are arabic english french and portuguese as well as african languages if possible
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a protocol amending the constitutive act adopted in 2003 but as of 2007 not yet in force added spanish swahili and any other african language and termed all six official rather than working languages of the african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in practice translation of documents of the au into even the four current working languages causes significant delays and difficulties to the conduct of business
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: founded in 2001 the african academy of languages promotes the usage and perpetuation of african languages amongst african people
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: member states of the african union cover almost the entirety of continental africa and several off shore islands
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: consequently the geography of the african union is wildly diverse including the world's largest hot desert the sahara huge jungles and savannas and the world's longest river the nile
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the au presently has an area of 29922059 km² 18592705 mi² with 24165 km 15015 mi of coastline
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the vast majority of this area is on continental africa while the only significant territory off the mainland is the island of madagascar the world's fourth largest accounting for slightly less than 2% of the total
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the individual member states of the african union coordinate foreign policy through this agency in addition to conducting their own international relations on a state by state basis
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the au represents the interests of african peoples at large in intergovernmental organisations igo's for instance it is a permanent observer at the united nations general assembly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: both the african union and the united nations work in tandem to address issues of common concerns in various areas
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union mission in united nations aspires to serve as a bridge between the two organisations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: membership of the au overlaps with other igos and occasionally these third party organisations and the au will coordinate matters of public policy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union maintains special diplomatic representation with the united states and the european union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the historical foundations of the african union originated in the union of african states an early confederation that was established by kwame nkrumah in the 1960s as well as subsequent attempts to unite africa including the organisation of african unity oau which was established on may 25 1963 and the african economic community in 1981
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: critics argued that the oau in particular did little to protect the rights and liberties of african citizens from their own political leaders often dubbing it the dictators club
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the idea of creating the au was revived in the mid 1990s under the leadership of libyan head of state muammar al gaddafi the heads of state and government of the oau issued the sirte declaration named after sirte in libya on september 9 1999 calling for the establishment of an african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the declaration was followed by summits at lome in 2000 when the constitutive act of the african union was adopted and at lusaka in 2001 when the plan for the implementation of the african union was adopted
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during the same period the initiative for the establishment of the new partnership for africa's development nepad was also established
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union was launched in durban on 9 july 2002 by its first chairperson south african thabo mbeki at the first session of the assembly of the african union
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the second session of the assembly was in maputo in 2003 and the third session in addis ababa on 6 july 2004
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the emblem of the african union consists of a gold ribbon bearing small interlocking red rings from which palm leaves shoot up around an outer gold circle and an inner green circle within which is a gold representation of africa
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the red interlinked rings stand for african solidarity and the blood shed for the liberation of africa the palm leaves for peace the gold for africa's wealth and bright future the green for african hopes and aspirations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to symbolise african unity the silhouette of africa is drawn without internal borders
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the flag of the african union bears a broad green horizontal stripe a narrow band of gold the emblem of the african union at the centre of a broad white stripe another narrow gold band and a final broad green stripe
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: again the green and gold symbolise africa's hopes and aspirations as well as its wealth and bright future and the white represents the purity of africa's desire for friends throughout the world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the flag has led to the creation of the national colours of africa of gold and green sometimes together with white
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these colours are visible in one way or another in the flags of many african nations
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: together the colours green gold and red constitute the pan african colours
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the african union has adopted a new anthem let us all unite and celebrate together and has the chorus o sons and daughters of africa flesh of the sun and flesh of the sky let us make africa the tree of life
lines.name: Newar

lines.name: Newar

lines.value: सजीव कोशिकातेसं जःया उर्जायात रासायनिक ऊर्जाय् हिलेगु प्रक्रियायात फोटोसिन्थेसिस धाइ। फोटोसिन्थेसिस प्रक्रियाय् वनस्पतितेसं थःगु वांगु अंग दसु हःय् सूर्द्यःया जःया उपस्थितिइ वायुं कार्बनडाइअक्साइड व बुं नं लः कया कम्प्लेक्स अर्‍ग्यानिक पदार्थ दसु कार्बोहाइड्रेट्सया निर्माण याइ व अक्सिजन ग्यास o 2 ) पिकाइ। फोटोसिन्थेसिस प्रक्रियाय् सूर्द्यःया जःया उपस्थितिइ वनस्पतिया वांगु हःय् दूगु सेलया दुने कार्बन डाइआक्साइड व लः स्वाना न्हापा साधारण कार्बोहाइड्रेट व लिपा जटिल काबोहाइड्रेटया देकेज्या जुइ। थ्व कथं अक्सिजन व ऊर्जा तःमि कार्बोहाइड्रेट सूक्रोज ग्लूकोज स्टार्च आदिया निर्माण जुइ व अक्सिजन ग्यास पिहां वै। लः कार्बनडाइअक्साइड सूर्द्यःया जः व क्लोरोफिल फोटोसिन्थेसिसयात मदेकः मगाः। थुकिलि लः व कार्बनडाइअक्साइड फोटोसिन्थेसिसया कच्चा पदार्थ ख। फोटोसिन्थेसिसया प्रक्रिया दक्ले महत्वपूर्ण जैवरासायनिक प्रकृयाय् छगू ख। छुं नं छुं रुपय् हलिमया सकल प्राणी थ्व हे प्रक्रियाय् आश्रित जु।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: प्राचीन काल निसें वनस्पतितेसं थःगु पोषण जरां याइ धाःगु खं मनुतेसं थुयावःगु दु। १७७२य् स्टिफन हेलेस नं वनस्पतिया हः वायु नं भोजन ग्रहण याइगु व थ्व क्रियाय् जःया महत्व दूगु खं प्रकाशित यानादिल। प्रिस्ट्लें १७७२य् दक्ले न्ह्यः सीकादिल कि थ्व प्रक्रिया बिले उत्पन्न वायुय् मैनमतो च्याकेछिं। मैनमतो च्यायेधुंका हानं वहे वायुलि म्वाम्ह छुं तःसा व छुं सी धकाः नं वय्‌कलं सीका दिल। वय्‌कलं १७७५य् हानं प्रकाशित यानादिल कि वनस्पतिं न्हिन्हे पिकाइगु ग्यास अक्सिजन ख। थ्व धुंका इंजन हाउसं १७७९य् सीकादिल कि वांगु वनस्पतिं सूर्द्यया जः दुबिले co 2 ग्रहण याइ व अक्सिजन पिकाइ। डि
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: सासूरं १८०४य् वनस्पतितेसं न्हिन्हे जक्क co 2 ग्रहण याइगु व o 2 पिकाइगु व नापं २४ घौय् हे अक्सिजन ग्रहण याना co 2 पिकाइगु वा सासः ल्हाइगु या धकाः सीकादिल। सासं १८८७य् लुइकादिल कि वांगु वनस्पतिया co 2 ग्रहण याइगु व o 2 पिकाइगु प्रक्रियां वनस्पतिइ स्टार्चया निर्माण जुइ।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: वांगु वनस्पतिइ जुइगु फोटोसिन्थेसिस प्रक्रिया सकल प्राणीतेगु निंतिं छगू महत्त्वपूर्ण प्रक्रिया ख। थ्व प्रक्रियाय् वनस्पतिं सूर्द्यःया जःया उर्जायात रासायनिक उर्जाय् हिलाछ्वइ व co 2 लः थें न्याःगु साधारण पदार्थं जटिल कार्बन यौगिक कार्बोहाइड्रेट्स देकी। थ्व कार्बोहाइड्रेट्सं हे मनु व प्राणितेसं भोजन प्राप्त याइ। थ्व कथं वनस्पतितेसं फोटोसिन्थेसिस प्रक्रियाद्वारा सकल प्राणी जगतया निंतिं भोजन-व्यवस्था याइ। सकल अर्‍ग्यानिक कम्पाउन्ड दसु कार्बोहाइड्रेट्स प्रोटिन फ्याट व भाइटामिन आदि प्रत्यक्ष-परोक्ष कथं थ्व हे प्रक्रियां दयावइ। रबर प्लास्टिक चिकं सेल्युलोज व यक्व वासः आदि नं थ्व हे प्रक्रियाया लिच्व ख। वांगु वनस्पतिं फोटोसिन्थेसिसया प्रक्रियाय् कार्बन डाईअक्साइड कया अक्सिजन पिकाइ अतः थ्व कथं थ्व प्रक्रियां वातावरणया होमियोस्ट्यासिस नं देकातइ। अक्सिजन सकल जन्तुतेत सासः ल्ह्यायेत मा। वातावरणया संरक्षणया निंतिं नं थ्व प्रक्रियाया यक्व महत्व दु। मत्स्य-पालनया निंतिं नं फोटोसिन्थेसिसया तःधंगु महत्त्व दु। फोटोसिन्थेसिसया प्रक्रिया म्हो जुइबिले लखे कार्बन डाई अक्साइडया मात्रा अप्वइ। लखे सिओटु ५ सी॰सी॰ प्रतिलीटर स्वया अप्व जुसा मत्स्य पालनय् प्रतिकुल हानिकारक असर जुइ। फोटोसिन्थेसिस जैविक इन्धन देकेयात नं सहायक जुइ। थ्व प्रक्रियां वनस्पतितेसं सौर ऊर्जाद्वारा जैव इन्धनया उत्पादन याइ। थ्व जैव ईंधन विभिन्न प्रक्रिया जुया विविध ऊर्जा स्रोततेगु उत्पादन याइ। दसु पशुतेगु गोबर कृषि अवशेषं जा भुतुलि जा थुइत देकिगु ग्यास आदि।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: h 2 o + सक्रिय क्लोरोफिल → h + + oh थ्व फोटोलाइसिस प्रक्रियाय् o 2 लः स्वया स्वतन्त्र जुइ व हाइड्रोजन नं हाइड्रोजन काइगु इन्टिटिइ वनि। 2h 2 o + 2a → 2ah 2 + o 2 थ्व कथं स्वामा/सिमाया फोटोसिन्थेसिस प्रक्रियां पिहां वःगु सकल अक्सिजन लखं वइ। हिल,रूबेन आदिं थ्व विचाःया समर्थन यानादिल नापं अक्सिजनया आइसोटोप o 18 छ्येला थ्व विचाःयात प्रमाणित नं यानादिल। थ्व विचाःया लिच्वः छु जुल धाःसा co 2 या अनुपस्थितिइ अक्सिजनया उत्पादन जुइ फु तर थुकिया निंतिं हाइड्रोजन काइगु छगू केमिकल इन्टिटि दये मा। थुकिया निंतिं वनस्पतिइ एनएडिपिं nadp निगु nadph 2 देकिगु खने दु। 2h 2 o+2nadp=2nadph 2 +o 2
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: अयुग्म फोटो-फोस्फोरीलेशनय् लःया अपघटनया कारणं इलेक्ट्रोन निरन्तर प्राप्त जुइ तथा फोटो-फोस्फोरीलेशनं क्लोरोफिलय् जः ऊर्जां एटीपीया निर्माण जुयाच्वनि। थ्व कथं क्लोरोफिल a सक्रिय जुइबिलय् फेरेडोक्सिनं इलेक्ट्रन ग्राहीया ज्या याइ। थुकियात एनएडीपी नांया coenzymeया ग्वहालिं एनएडी लः द्वारा त्वतुगु हाइड्रोजनयात ज्वना nadph २ य् हिलावनि। युग्म फोटो-फोस्फोरीलेशनया क्रियाय् सूर्द्यःया प्रकाशं क्लोरोफिल a सक्रिय जुया इलेक्ट्रनयात पिने वांछ्वइ गुकियात क्लोरोफिलय् दूगु फैरीडाक्सीनं ज्वना तै। थ्व इलेक्ट्रोन मुक्त जुइ धुंका प्लास्टोक्वीनोन नामक इलेक्ट्रोन ग्राहीं ज्वनि। थ्व क्रियाया दथुइ एडीपी एटीपीइ परिवर्तित जुइ व इलेक्ट्रोन पुनः मुक्त जुया साइटोक्रोम विकर जुया क्लोरोफिल a'य् लिहां वनि। थ्व क्रियाय् नं एडीपी एटीपीइ हिलावनि। थ्व क्रियाय् पिनेया इलेक्ट्रोन प्रयोग जुइमखु तथा क्लोरोफिलं इलेक्ट्रोन पिहांवया हानं लिहां वनि।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ::co 2 + 2ah 2 → ch 2 o + 2a + h 2 o ch 2 o यह एक कार्बोहाइड्रेट्स की इकाई अणु है। केल्विन व बैनसन ने रेडियो आइसोटोपिक तकनीक का प्रयोग कर बताया कि प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की प्रक्रिया में पहला स्थाई यौगिक एक ३ कार्बन वाला 3-फोस्फोग्लिसेरिक अम्ल पीजीए बनता है। क्लोरोल्ला एवं सिनडेसमस नामक शैवालों में रेडियो एक्टिव c 14 o 2 की उपस्थिति में कुछ समय के लिए प्रकाश-संश्लेषण कराया गया तथा इनमें भी पहला स्थाई द्रव्य फोस्फोग्लिसेरिक अम्ल बना। यह फोस्फोग्लिसेरिक अम्ल बाद में ग्लूकोज बनाता है।इस प्रकार केल्विन तथा उसके सहकर्मियों के कार्यों से यह सिद्ध हो गया कि प्रकाश-संश्लेषण प्रक्रिया में co 2 ग्लूकोज में परिवर्तित हो जाती है। उन्होंने इस प्रयोग में कार्बन के समस्थानिक c 14 ) का प्रयोग किया। क्लोरोफिल में राइबुलोज-15 विसफास्फेट उपस्थित रहता है। अब वायुमण्डलीय co 2 पत्ती के स्टोमेटा द्वारा प्रवेश कर अन्दर पहुँचती है तथा तुरन्त ही ४/१0000000 सेकेण्ड में राइबुलोज-15 विसफास्फेट के साथ मिलकर एक अस्थाई यौगिक का निर्माण कती है। इस प्रकार बना अस्थाई यौगिक जो ५-कार्बन सुगर है शीघ्र ही फास्फोग्लाइसेरिक एसिड pga के २ अणुओं में टूट जाता है। अब यहां पर nadph 2 द्वारा हाइड्रोजन मुक्त किये जाने पर पीजीए को पीजीएएल phosphoglyceric aldehyde में परिवर्तित कर देता है। इस क्रिया में ऊर्जा एटीपी से प्राप्त होती है। इस प्रकार co 2 से कार्बोहाइड्रेट्स निर्माण हो जाते हैं।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की अंधेरी प्रक्रिया में जिन पौधों में पहला स्थाई यौगिक फास्फोग्लिसरिक अम्ल बनता है उन्हें c 3 पौधा कहते हैं। फास्फोग्लिसरिक अम्ल एक ३ कार्बन वाला योगिक है इसलिए इन पौधों का ऐसा नामकरण है। जिन पौधों में पहला स्थाई यौगिक ४ कार्बन वाला यौगिक बनता है उनको c 4 पौधा कहते हैं। साधारणतः ४ कार्बन वाला यौगिक ओक्सैलोएसिटिक अम्ल ओएए बनता है। पहले ऐसा विश्वास किया जाता था कि प्रकाश-संश्लेषण में कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड के स्थिरीकरण या यौगिकीकरण के समय केवल c 3 या केल्विन चक्र ही होता था अर्थात पहला स्थाई यौगिक फास्फोग्लिसरिक अम्ल ही बनता है। लेकिन १९६६ में हैच एवं स्लैक ने बताया कि कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड के स्थिरीकरण का एक दूसरा पथ भी है। उन्होंने गन्ना मक्का अमेरेन्थस आदि पौधों में अध्ययन कर बताया कि फोस्फोइनोल पाइरूविक अम्ल जो कि ३ कार्बन विशिष्ठ यौगिक है कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड से संयुक्त होकर ४ कार्बन विशिष्ठ यौगिक ओक्सैलोएसिटिक अम्ल बनाता है। इस क्रिया में फोस्फोइनोल पाइरूवेट कार्बोक्सिलेज इन्जाइम उत्प्रेरक का कार्य करता है।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड प्रकाश-संश्लेषण का एक मुख्य अवयव तथा कच्चा पदार्थ है। वायुमंडल में कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड गैस श्वसन दहन किण्वन विघटन आदि क्रियाओं के द्वारा मुक्त होती है। वायु में इसकी मात्रा 0.0३ % से 0.0४ % होती है। स्थलीय पौधे इसे सीधे ही वायु से ग्रहण कर लेते हैं। इन पौधों की पत्तियों में छोटे छिद्र होते हैं जिन्हे पर्णरन्ध्र कहते हैं। कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड इन्हीं पर्णरन्ध्रों से पौधे की पत्तियों में प्रवेश करती है। जलमग्न पौधे जल में घुली कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड को अपनी शारीरिक सतह से विसरण द्वारा ग्रहण करते हैं। जल में कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड का स्रोत जलीय जन्तु हैं जिनके श्वसन में यह गैस उत्पन्न होती है। जल के भीतर चट्टानों में उपस्थित कार्बोनेट तथा बाइकार्बोनेट के विघटन से भी कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड उत्पन्न होती है जिसको जलीय पौधे प्रकाश-संश्लेषण में ग्रहण करते हैं। प्रकाश-संश्लेषण में ग्लूकोज c 6 h 12 o 6 ) नामक कार्बोहाइड्रेट का निर्माण होता है। इसमें कार्बन c तथा ऑक्सीजन c तत्व के परमाणु कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड co 2 ) से ही प्राप्त होते हैं। क्लोरोफिल क्लोरोफिल एक प्रोटीनयुक्त जटिल रासायनिक यौगिक है। यह प्रकाश-संश्लेषण का मुख्य वर्णक है। क्लोरोफिल ए तथा क्लोरोफिल बी दो प्रकार का होता है। यह सभी स्वपोषी हरे पौधों के क्लोरोप्लास्ट में पाया जाता है। क्लोरोफिल के अणु सूर्य के प्रकाशीय ऊर्जा को अवशोषित कर उसे रासायनिक ऊर्जा में रूपान्तरित करते हैं। सूर्य के प्रकाशीय ऊर्जा को अवशोषित करके क्लोरोफिल का अणु उत्तेजित हो जाते हैं। ये सक्रिय अणु जल के अणुओं को h + तथा oh आयन में विघटित कर देते हैं। इस प्रकार क्लोरोफिल के अणु प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की जैव-रसायनिक क्रिया को प्रारम्भ करते हैं।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की क्रिया अनेक कारकों द्वारा प्रभावित होती है। इसके कुछ कारक बाह्य होते हैं तथा कुछ आंतरिक। इसके अतिरिक्त कुछ सीमाबद्ध कारक भी होते हैं। बाह्य कारण वे होते है जो प्रकृति व पर्यावरण में स्थित होते हुए फोटोसिन्थेसिस को प्रभावित करते हैं जैसे प्रकाश चूँकि सूर्य के प्रकाश से पौधा इस क्रिया के लिए ऊर्जा प्राप्त करता है तथा अंधेरे से यह क्रिया सम्भव ही नहीं है। कार्बनडाई ऑक्साइड क्यों कि ऐसा देखा गया है कि यदि अन्य सभी कारक पौधे को उच्चतम मात्रा में प्राप्त हों तथा वायुमंडल में co 2 की मात्रा धीरे-धीरे बढ़ाई जाये तो प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की दर भी बढ़ जाती है। तापमान क्यो कि देखा गया है कि पौधों में प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की क्रिया के लिये एक निश्चित तापक्रम की भी आवश्यकता होती है तथा जल,पानी फोटोकेमिकल प्रक्रियाओं के अत्यंत आवश्यक है व यह इस क्रिया के समय अनेक रासायनिक परिवर्तनों में सहयोग करता है। आंतरिक कारण वे होते हैं जो पत्तियों में स्थित होते हुए फोटोसिन्थेसिस की क्रिया को प्रभावित करते हैं जैसे पर्ण हरिम या क्लोरोफ़िल जिसके द्वारा प्रकाश ऊर्जा रासायनिक ऊर्जा में परिवर्तित होती है। प्ररस या प्रोटोप्लाज्म जिसमें पाए जाने वाले विकर प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की क्रिया को प्रभावित करते हैं। भोज्य पदार्थ का जमाव क्यों कि प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की क्रिया में बना भोजन यदि स्थानीय कोशिकाओं में एकत्रित होता रहे तो प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की दर धीमी हो जाती है। पत्तियों की आंतरिक संरचना क्यों कि प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की दर पत्तियों में उपस्थित स्टोमेटा या रंध्रों की संख्या तथा उनके बंद एवं खुलने के समय पर निर्भर करती है। पत्तियों की आयु क्यों कि नई पत्तियों में पुरानी पत्तियों की अपक्षा प्रकाश-संश्लेषण की दर अधिक होती है। इसके अतिरिक्त फोटोसिन्थेसिस को इन सभी वस्तुओं की अलग-अलग गति भी प्रभावित करती है। जब फोटोसिन्थेसिस की एक क्रिया विभिन्न कारकों द्वारा नियन्त्रित होती है तब फोटोसिन्थेसिस की गति सबसे मन्द कारक द्वारा नियंत्रित होती है। प्रकाश कार्बनडाइऑक्साइड जल क्लोरोफिल इत्यादि में से जो भी उचित परिमाण से कम परिमाण में होता है वह पूरी क्रिया की गति को नियन्त्रित रखता है। यह कारक समय विशेष के लिए सीमाबद्ध कारक कहा जाता है।

lines.value: ambroise pare pioneered the treatment of wounds by gunshots
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: among the first modern surgeons were battlefield doctors in the napoleonic wars who were primarily concerned with amputation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: naval surgeons were often barber surgeons who combined surgery with their main jobs as barbers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in london an operating theatre or operating room from the day before modern anaesthesia or antiseptic surgery still exists and is open to the public
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is found in the roof space of st thomas church southwark london and is called the old operating theatre
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: before modern surgical developments there was a very real threat that a patient would bleed out on the table during an operation or bleed to death while being attended after an accident or wound
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first real progress in combating bleeding had come when early cultures realized they could close wounds using extremes of heat a procedure called cauterizing
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the early cauterization was successful but only useable in a limited fashion highly destructive and painful with terrible long term outcomes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the next real breakthrough to come was the invention of ligatures something widely believed to have originated with ambrose pare during the 16th century
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a ligature is a piece of material used to tie closed the end of a cut blood vessel preventing any further bleeding by serving to occlude it
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ligatures form the basis of modern control bleeding but at the time they were more of a hazard than a help because the surgeons using them had no concept of infection control
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a final barrier to be overcome was the problem of replacing blood lost
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: limiting bleeding is important but ultimately a surgeon is fighting a losing battle if blood cannot be replaced and this final barrier was only conquered when early 20th century research into blood groups allowed the first effective blood transfusions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: big holes into sealed internal environments lead to infections especially if the surgeon is using dirty tools covered in blood and wearing his normal clothes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first progress in combating infection was made by the hungarian doctor semmelweiss who noticed that medical students fresh from the dissecting room were causing excess maternal death compared to midwives
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: semmelweiss despite ridicule and opposition introduced compulsory handwashing for everyone entering the maternal wards and was rewarded with a plunge in maternal and fetal deaths however the royal society in the uk still dismissed his advice
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the next true progress came when after reading a paper by louis pasteur the british surgeon joseph lister began experimenting with using phenol during surgery to prevent infections
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: lister was able to quickly improve infection rates no end a process that was further helped by his subsequent introduction of techniques to sterilise equipment have rigorous hand washing and a later implementation of rubber gloves
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: lister published his work as a series of articles in the lancet march 1867 under the title antiseptic principle of the practice of surgery
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the work was groundbreaking and laid the foundations for a rapid advance in infection control that saw modern aseptic operating theatres widely used within 50 years lister himself went on to make further strides in antisepsis and asepsis throughout his lifetime
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the gradual development of germ theory has allowed the final step to be taken to create the highest quality of aseptic conditions in modern hospitals and this has allowed us to theoretically perform infection free surgery
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: anesthesia was discovered by two american dentists horace wells 1815-1848 and william morton
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: before the advent of anesthesia surgery was a traumatically painful procedure and surgeons were encouraged to be as swift as possible to minimize patient suffering
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this also meant that operations were largely restricted to amputations and external growth removals
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: beginning in the 1840s surgery began to change dramatically in character with the discovery of effective and practical anaesthetic chemicals such as ether and chloroform
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in britain john snow pioneered the use of these two anaesthetics
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition to relieving patient suffering anaesthesia allowed more intricate operations in the internal regions of the human body
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in addition the discovery of muscle relaxants such as curare allowed for safer applications
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the united kingdom australia south africa and new zealand surgeons are distinguished from physicians by being referred to as mister this tradition has its origins in the 18th century when surgeons were barber surgeons and did not have a degree or indeed any formal qualification unlike physicians who were doctors with a university medical degree
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by the beginning of the 19th century surgeons had obtained high status and in 1800 the royal college of surgeons rcs in london began to offer surgeons a formal status via rcs membership
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the title mister became a badge of honour and today only surgeons who are fellows of the royal college of surgeons generally call themselves mister miss mrs or ms in the course of their professional practice
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by contrast north american physicians and surgeons are always addressed as doctor the title of doctor is represented in a physician and surgeon's name by the title md do dpm dds or dmd following his her surname
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: * facs
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: मस्कुलर प्रणाली मनूम्हय छगू म्हकुचा पुचः ख। थ्व म्हकुचापुचलय् कवँ लाधी पेचूगु लाधी smooth muscle व नुगः लाधी muscle ला। थ्व म्हकुचापुचलं म्ह संकिगु म्हया मुद्रा व आसन दयेकिगु व म्हय् हिबाहा संकिगु ज्या याइ। जँक्वँय् दूगु म्वामिइ लाधी कुचापुचःयात साधारनकथं स्नायु प्रणालीं व्यवस्थित याइ। अथेजुसां नुगःलापुचः धाःसा थमंतुं हे सञ्चालित जुइ। कवं प्रणालीनाप सहकार्य यासें थ्व प्रणालीं मस्कुलोस्केलितल सिस्तम वा कवँ-लाधी व्यवस्था दयेकी।

lines.value: georgia totto o'keeffe november 15 1887-march 61986 was an american artist
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she is associated with the american southwest where she found artistic inspiration and particularly new mexico where she settled late in life
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe has been a major figure in american art since the 1920s
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she is chiefly known for paintings in which she synthesized abstraction and representation in paintings of flowers rocks shells animal bones and landscapes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her paintings present crisply contoured forms that are replete with subtle tonal transitions of varying colors
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she often transformed her subject matter into powerful abstract images
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe was born in a farmhouse in sun prairie wisconsin
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her parents francis calyxtus o'keeffe and ida totto o'keeffe were dairy farmers
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her father was of irish descent
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ida totto's father george for whom georgia was named was a hungarian immigrant
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: through her mother georgia o'keeffe was also related to edward fuller one of the passengers on the mayflower and a signer of the mayflower compact
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe's maternal connection was descended from edward fuller's son matthew
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she was the first girl and the second of seven o'keeffe children
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she attended town hall school in wisconsin and received art instruction from local watercolorist sara mann
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she attended high school at sacred heart academy in madison wisconsin as a boarder between 1901 and 1902
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in fall 1902 the o'keeffes moved from wisconsin to williamsburg in coastal virginia
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: georgia stayed in wisconsin with her aunt and attended madison high school and joined her family in williamsburg in 1903
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she completed high school as a boarder at chatham episcopal institute in virginia now chatham hall and graduated in 1905
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: education for women was a family tradition
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: georgia's mother ida had been educated in the east
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all the daughters but one became professional women attesting to her influence on them
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1905 o'keeffe enrolled at the school of the art institute of chicago
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1907 she attended the art students league in new york city where she studied with william merritt chase
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1908 she won the league's william merritt chase still life prize for her oil painting mona shehab dead rabbit with copper pot
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her prize was a scholarship to attend the league's outdoor summer school at lake george new york
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while in the city in 1908 o'keeffe had attended an exhibition of rodin's watercolors at the 291 owned by her future husband photographer alfred stieglitz
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the fall of 1908 discouraged with her work o'keeffe did not return to the league but moved to chicago and found work as a commercial artist
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during this period georgia did not pick up a brush and she said that the smell of turpentine made her sick
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she became an elementary school art teacher near amarillo in the texas panhandle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she was inspired to paint again in 1912 when she attended a class at the university of virginia summer school where she was introduced to the innovative ideas of arthur wesley dow by alon bement
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: dow's teachings encouraged artists to express themselves through harmonious compositions and contrasts of light and dark
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: dow's teaching strongly influenced o'keeffe's thinking about the process of making art
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she served as a teaching assistant to bement for several years before returning to texas to teach in the art department of the fledgling west texas a&m university then west texas state normal college in canyon just south of amarillo
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she was inspired to go there because of the natural beauty of the nearby large palo duro canyon carved by wind and water
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: early in 1916 anita pollitzer took some of o'keeffe's drawings to alfred stieglitz at his 291 gallery
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he told anita the drawings were the purest finest sincerest things that had entered 291 in a long while and that he would like to show them
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe had first visited 291 in 1908 but had never talked with stieglitz although she had high regard for his opinions as a critic
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in april 1916 stieglitz exhibited ten of her drawings
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe had not been consulted before the exhibit and only learned about it through an acquaintance
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she confronted stieglitz for the first time over the drawings
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she agreed to let them hang
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: georgia o'keeffe's first solo show opened at 291 in april 1917
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most of the exhibit were the watercolors from texas
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: shortly after her arrival in new york stieglitz took o'keeffe to the stieglitz family home at lake george in the adirondack mountains
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they would return to the lake home each summer for years to come
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: georgia produced many paintings of the lake george countryside during these years
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: stieglitz arranged for o'keeffe to live in his niece's unoccupied studio apartment
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by july he and o'keeffe had fallen deeply in love
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he left his wife emmeline obermeyer stieglitz to live with o'keeffe
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: after he was divorced in 1924 o'keeffe and stieglitz married
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they spent winter and spring in manhattan and summer and fall at the stieglitz family house at lake george
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: stieglitz had started photographing o'keeffe when she visited him in new york to see her 1917 exhibition
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he continued making photographs of her taking more than 300 portraits between 1918 and 1937
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most of the more erotic poses were from the first few years of their marriage
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in february 1921 forty five of stieglitz's photographs including many of o'keeffe and some in the nude were exhibited in a retrospective exhibition at the anderson galleries
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the photographs of o'keeffe created a public sensation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during her early years in new york city o'keeffe grew to know the many early american modernists who were part of stieglitz's circle of friends including charles demuth arthur dove marsden hartley paul strand and edward steichen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: strand's photography as well as that of stieglitz and his many photographer friends inspired o'keeffe's work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: soon after she moved to new york she began working primarily in oil which represented a shift away from her having worked in watercolor in the 1910s
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by the mid 1920s o'keeffe began making large scale paintings of natural forms at close range as if seen through a magnifying lens
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during the 1920s o'keeffe made both natural and architectural forms the subject of her work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1924 she painted her first large scale flower painting petunia no
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: 2 which was first exhibited in 1925
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she quickly completed a significant body of paintings of new york buildings such as city night and new yorknight 1926 and radiator bldg--night new york 1927
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: beginning in 1923 stieglitz organized annual exhibitions of o'keeffe's work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by the mid 1920s o'keeffe had become known as one of america's most important artists
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her work commanded high prices in 1928 six of her calla lily paintings sold for $25000 us dollars which was the largest sum ever paid for a group of paintings by a living american artist
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this drew media attention to o'keeffe as never before
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by 1928 o'keeffe began to feel the need to travel and find other sources for painting
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the demands of an annual show needed new material
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: friends returning with stories from the west stimulated o'keeffe's desire to see and explore new places
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in may 1929 she set out by train with her friend beck strand to taos new mexico
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they went to santa fe and then to albuquerque
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: soon after their arrival o'keeffe and strand were invited to stay at mabel dodge luhan's ranch outside of taos for the summer
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe went on many pack trips exploring the rugged mountains and deserts of the region
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on one trip she visited the d h lawrence ranch and spent several weeks there
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while in taos new mexico in 1929 o'keeffe visited the historical mission church at ranchos de taos
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although many artists had made paintings of the church o'keeffe's painting of a fragment of the mission wall silhouetted against the dark blue sky captured it in a different way
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: between 1929 and 1949 o'keeffe spent part of nearly every year working in new mexico
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during her second summer there she began collecting and painting bones and started painting the area's distinctive architectural and landscape forms
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: each fall she returned to new york
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1932 o'keeffe suffered a nervous breakdown following an uncompleted radio city music hall mural project that had fallen behind schedule
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she was hospitalized in early 1933 and did not paint again until january 1934
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the spring of 1933 and 1934 o'keeffe recuperated in bermuda and she returned to new mexico in the summer of 1934
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: that summer she discovered ghost ranch an area north of abiquiu whose varicolored cliffs inspired some of her most famous landscapes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1940 she purchased a house on the ranch property
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a loner o'keeffe explored this place she loved on her own
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she bought a model a ford and asked others to teach her how to drive
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: after one particularly exasperating moment one of her teachers declared that she was unable to learn the art of driving
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: only her determination was to lead to mastering her machine
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in june 1934 o'keeffe visited ghost ranch for the first time and decided immediately to live there
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the ranch is located in a remote area approximately 120 miles north of albuquerque
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: among guests to visit her at the ranch were d h lawrence charles and anna lindbergh and ansel adams
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the 1930s and 1940s o'keeffe's reputation and popularity continued to grow earning her numerous commissions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: her work was included in exhibitions in and around new york
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1936 summer days a painting featuring a cattle skull adorned with various wildflowers against a desert background was completed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it would become one of her most famous and well known works
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the 1940s o'keeffe had two one woman retrospectives the first at the art institute of chicago in 1943 and the second in 1946 at the museum of modern art in new york
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it was the first retrospective moma held for a woman artist
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe also was awarded honorary degrees by numerous universities the first by the college of william and mary in 1938
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the mid 1940s the whitney museum of american art sponsored a project to establish the first catalogue of her work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1945 o'keeffe bought a second home an abandoned hacienda in abiquiu some 16 miles 26 km south of ghost ranch
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the abiquiu house was renovated through 1948 and became the setting for many later paintings
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: while o'keeffe was spending the summer of 1946 in new mexico stieglitz suffered a cerebral thrombosis
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she quickly flew to new york to be with him
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he died on july 13 1946
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she took his ashes to lake george and buried them at the foot of a tall pine tree beside the lake
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: although separated for long periods through the years stieglitz had taken care of many business details for o'keeffe
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she now had to take on these responsibilities
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1949 o'keeffe moved to new mexico permanently
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during the 1950s o'keeffe produced a series of paintings featuring the architectural forms patio wall and door--of her adobe house in abiquiu
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: another distinctive painting of the decade was ladder to the moon 1958
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: from her first world travels in the late 1950s o'keeffe produced an extensive series of paintings of clouds such as above the clouds i 1962/1963
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these were inspired by her views from the windows of airplanes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: below is an external link to a color image of one of these aerial cloudscape canvases
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1962 o'keeffe was elected to the fifty member american academy of arts and letters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the fall of 1970 the whitney museum of american art mounted the georgia o'keeffe retrospective exhibition the first major showing of her work since 1946 the year stieglitz died
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this exhibit did much to revive her public career
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it brought o'keeffe to the attention of a new generation of women raised on the principles of feminism
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1971 georgia became aware that her eyesight was failing
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: at the age of 84 she was losing her central vision and only had peripheral sight an irreversible eye degeneration disease
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she stopped painting in 1972
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: juan hamilton a young potter appeared at georgia's ranch house in 1973 looking for work
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she hired him for a few odd jobs and soon employed him full time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: he became her closest confidante companion and business manager until her death
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe dabbled in pottery herself and had a large kiln installed at the ranch for firing pots
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: even with her dimming eyesight she was inspired by hamilton and others to paint again
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she hired a studio assistant to execute some of her ideas
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during this time she agreed to accept interviews and other opportunities
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1976 she wrote a book about her art with hamilton's help
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she also allowed a film crew to do a documentary at ghost ranch
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: o'keeffe became increasingly frail in her late 90's
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: she moved to santa fe where she died on march 6 1986 at the age of 98
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: per her instructions she was cremated the next day
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: juan hamilton walked to the top of the pedernal mountain and scattered her ashes to the wind over her beloved faraway
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: following o'keeffe's death her family contested her will because codicils to it made in the 1980s had left all of her estate to hamilton
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the case was ultimately settled in july 1987
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the case which was settled out of court became famous as case law in estate planning
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a substantial part of her estate's assets were transferred to the georgia o'keeffe museum established in santa fe in 1997 to perpetuate o'keeffe's artistic legacy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these assets included a large body of her work photographs archival materials and her abiquiu house library and property
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the georgia o'keeffe home and studio was designated a national historic landmark in 1998
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the 1993 warren zevon song splendid isolation mentions how zevon in his search for solitude wants to be like georgia o'keeffe
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the georgia o'keeffe foundation to transfer assets to georgia o'keeffe museum press release
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: ह्यांगु सागरयागु दक्षिणी भाग marks a fork in the rift। इथियोपिया व एरितृयायागु अफार त्रिभूज वा दानाकिल डिप्रेसन ट्रिपल जंक्सनयागु थाय् जुइफु। एडेनयागु खाडी रिफ्टयागु पूर्वी निरन्तरता खः रिफ्ट दे स्वया न्ह्य अरबी प्रायद्विप अफ्रिकायागु न्येकु नाप स्वानाच्वंगु जुल व थ्व थासं मध्य महासाग‍रीय रिजयागु रुपे हिन्द महासागरय् निरन्तरता बी। दक्षिणपश्चिम दिशाय् थ्व तधंगु रिफ्ट स्वनिगयागु रुपे निरन्तर जुइ व एथियोपियाली हाइल्यान्डयात निगु भागय् बाई। केन्याय् नैरोबीयागु उत्तरय् थ्व स्वनिग दकले गा वं। as the lakes in the eastern rift have no outlet to the sea these lakes tend to be shallow and have a high mineral content as the evaporation of water leaves the salts behind
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example lake magadi has high concentrations of soda sodium carbonate and lake elmenteita lake baringo lake bogoria and lake nakuru are all strongly alkaline while lake naivasha needs to be supplied by freshwater springs to support its biological variety
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the formation of the rift valley continues probably driven by mantle plumes and ultimately a result of the african superswell
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the associated geothermal activity and spreading at the rift has caused the lithosphere to thin from a typical 100 km thickness for continents to a mere 20 km
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: though it is common for one arm of a triple junction to fail if spreading continues the lithosphere may rupture several million years hence splitting eastern africa off to form a new landmass
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in short this will lead to the formation of a new mid ocean ridge
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the volcanic activity at this site and unusual concentration of hotspots has produced the volcanic mountains mount kilimanjaro mount kenya mount karisimbi mount nyiragongo mount meru and mount elgon as well as the crater highlands in tanzania
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the ol doinyo lengai volcano remains active and is currently the only natrocarbonatite volcano in the world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the rift valley has been a rich source of fossils that allow study of human evolution especially in an area known as piedmont
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: because the rapidly eroding highlands have filled the valley with sediments a favourable environment for the preservation of remains has been created
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the bones of several hominid ancestors of modern humans have been found there including those of lucy a nearly complete australopithecine skeleton which was discovered by anthropologist donald johanson
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: richard and mary leakey have also done significant work in this region
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: दक्षिण अमेरिका स्पेनी भाषा america del sur पोर्चुगिज america do sul उत्तर अमरीकाया दक्षिण पूर्वय् स्थित पश्चिमी गोलार्द्धया छगू महाद्वीप ख। दक्षिण अमेरिका उत्तरय् १३ ० उत्तरी अक्षांश ग्यालिनस अन्तरीप निसें दक्षिणय् ५६ ० दक्षिणी अक्षांश हर्न अन्तरीप तक्क व पूर्वय् ३५ ० पश्चिमी देशान्तर रेशिको अन्तरीप निसें पश्चिमय् ८१ ० पश्चिमी देशान्तर पारिना अन्तरीप तक्क विस्तृत दु। थ्व महादेशया उत्तरय् क्यारिबियन सागर व पनामा नहर पूर्व व उत्तर-पूर्वय् आन्ध्र महासागर पश्चिमय् प्रशान्त महासागर व दक्षिणय् अण्टार्कटिक महासागर ला। भूमध्य रेखा थ्व महादेशया उत्तरी भागं व मकर रेखा मध्यं वनि। थुकिया कारणं थ्व महादेशया अधिकांश भाग उष्ण कटिबन्धय् ला। दक्षिण अमेरिकाया उत्तर निसें दक्षिण तक्कया हाकः लगभग ७,२०० किलोमीटर व पश्चिम निसें पूर्व ब्या ५,१२० किलोमीटर दु। हलिमया थ्व प्यंगु दक्ले तःधंगु महादेश ख। थ्व महादेश‌ आकार कथं भारत स्वया ६ गुनाति तःधं। पनापा नहरं थुकियात पनामा नहरय् उत्तर अमरीका महादेश स्वया अलग याइ तर पनामा देशयात आधिकारिक कथं धाःसा उत्तर अमरीकाय् कायेगु या।

lines.value: प्रबोधनया युग वा आत्मज्ञानया युग age of enlightenment वा प्रबोधन वा तार्किक युग १८गु शताब्दीया युरोपेली बुद्धिजीवी वर्गया सांस्कृतिक आन्दोलन ख। थ्व आन्दोलनं तार्किक शक्तियात छ्येला सामाजिक सुधार व ज्ञानया विकास यायेगु कुतः यात। थुकिलिं बौद्धिक आदान-प्रदानयात तिबः बिल धाःसा चर्च व राज्यया असहिष्णुता व यातनाया विरोध यात। करिब १६५०-१७००य् उत्त्पत्ति जूगु थ्व आन्दोलनया पलिस्थामि दार्शनिक बारुच स्पिनोजा baruch spinoza 1632-1677 जोन लक john locke 1632-1704 पियरे बेली pierre bayle 1647-1706 व आइज्याक न्युटन isaac newton 1643-1727 ख। सत्ताधारी राजकुमारतयेसं यक्व थासय् थःगु सरकारय् थ्व क्रान्तिया समर्थकतयेगु दर्शन समर्थन व पालन याःगु खनेदु। प्रबोधन करिब १७९०-१८०० तक्क विकास जुल। थ्व धुंका मानव भावना व संवेदना केन्द्रित रोमान्तिसिजम व आत्मज्ञान विरोधी तत्त्व बल्लाना वल। आत्मज्ञानया केन्द्र फ्रान्स ख। फ्रान्सय् थ्व क्रान्तिया लिच्वःया रुपय् देनिस दिदेरों denis diderot 1713-1784 संपादन यानादिगु इन्साइक्लोपेदि encyclopedie 1751-72 पिथन गुकिलि सच्छिंवं दार्शनिक दसु भोल्तायर 1694-1778 मोन्तेस्क्यु montesquieu 1689-1755 आदिया च्वसु योगदान दु। थ्व ग्रन्थया ३५ भोलुम करिब २५००० प्रति मिल गुकिया बच्छि फ्रान्स स्वया पिनेया मनुतयेसं न्यागु ख। थ्व न्हुगु वैचारिक शक्ति युरोपया नगरी क्षेत्रय् फैलेजुल। इङ्गल्यान्द स्कतल्यान्द जर्मन राज्य नेदरल्यान्द रुस इताली अस्त्रिता स्पेन जुजुं थ्व दर्शन एत्लान्तिक पुला अमेरिकी उपनिवेषय् बेञ्जामिन फ्र्याङ्क्लिन benjamin franklin व टमस जेफरसन thomas jefferson आदि थें न्यापिं अमेरिकी क्रान्तिया मू वैचारिकतयेत नापं प्रभाव यात। थ्व युगया राजनैतिक दर्शनया प्रभावं अमेरिकी स्वतन्त्रताया घोषणा अमेरिकी बिल अफ राइत्स फ्रेञ्च मनु व नागरिकया अधिकारया घोषणा declaration of the rights of man and of the citizen व मे ३ सन् १७९१या पोलिश-लिथुआनियन संविधान जारी जुल।

lines.value: संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया छगु दक्षिणपूर्वी राज्य खः। थ्व राज्यया राजधानी व दकलय् तःधंगु नगर कोलम्बिया ख। थ्व राज्यया जनसंख्या करिब ४२ लखः दु। जनसंख्या कथं थ्व संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया २४गू दकलय् तःधंगु राज्य ख। राज्यया क्षेत्र कथं धाःसा थ्व राज्य संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया ४०गू दकलय् तःधंगु राज्य ख। थ्व राज्यया मेमेगु मू नगरय् चार्ल्सतन ग्रीनभिल स्पार्तनबर्ग एन्दर्सन सम्तर व फ्लोरेन्स ला। थ्व राज्यया मू भौगोलिक बनावटय् तट ब्यारियर आइल्यान्द साल्त मार्श salt marsh sand hills rolling piedmont व ब्लु रिज माउन्तेन blue ridge mountains ला। थ्व राज्यय् यक्व पर्यटक थनया प्राकृतिक सौन्दर्यता स्वयेत वैगु या विशेषकथं मर्तल बीच myrtle beach चार्ल्सतन charleston व हिल्तन हेद आइल्यान्द hilton head island)।

lines.value: गणतन्त्र माली फ्रेञ्च भाषा rpublique du mali अंग्रेजी republic of mali पश्चिमी अफ्रिकाया छगू भूपरिवेष्ठित देय्‌ ख। थ्व देय्‌ अफ्रिका महादेशया ७गु दक्ले तःधंगु देय्‌ ख। मालीया सीमाय् उत्तरय् अल्जेरिया पूर्वय् नाइजर दक्षिणय् बुर्किना फासो व आइभोरी कोस्ट दक्षिण पश्चिमय् गिनिया व पश्चिमय् सेनेगल व माउरीतानिया ला। उत्तरय् छगू सीधा हाकलं थुकिया सीमा दक्षिण सहारा तक्क थ्यं। दक्षिणय् थ्व देय्‌या आपालं मनुतेगु बसोबास दु व थुकिया सीमा नाइजर व सेनेगलय् ला। थ्व थासय् यक्व खुसि नं दु। फ्रान्सया सूडान उपनिवेशया भाग थ्व देय्‌ सन् १९५९इ माली गणराज्यया रुपय् स्वतन्त्र जुल्। थ्व देय्‌या राजधानी बमाको ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: माली साम्राज्य(mali empire पश्चिमी अफ्रिकाय् सन् १२३५ निसें १६४५ तक्क दयाच्वन। थनया मनुतेसं दयेकातःगु साम्राज्यय् घाना साम्राज्य ghana empire माली साम्राज्य व सोङ्घाइ साम्राज्य songhai empire ला। टिम्बक्टु timbuktu थ्व साम्राज्यतेगु मू नगर ख। थ्व नगर सहारा मरुभूमिं जुइगु सकल बनेज्याया केन्द्र व धार्मिक केन्द्र नं ख। थ्व थासय् फ्रान्सेलीतेगु प्रवेश सन् १८८०इ जुल व फ्रान्सेली उपनिवेश सेप्टेम्बर ८ सन् १८८०इ च्वेया सेनेगल upper senegal)या रुपय् जूवन। लिपा अगस्ट १८ सन् १८९०इ थ्व थाय्‌या नां हिला फ्रान्सेली सुडान जूवन व केयिज kayes थुकिया राजधानी जुल। अक्टोबर १० सन् १८९९इ उपनिवेश भंग जुया ११गु दक्षिणी प्रान्त फ्रेञ्च गिनी आइभोरी कोस्ट व दोहामबे जुवन। थुकिया निगु प्रान्त लिपा लिहां वल। अक्टोबर ४ सन् १९५८य् फ्रेञ्च संवैधानिक संसोधन धुंका फ्रेञ्च सुडान फ्रेञ्च कम्युनिटी french community)या सदस्य जुल व सन् १९५८या नोभेम्बर २५ खुनु थुकियात आन्तरिक स्वाधीनता दत। अप्रिल ४ सन् १९५९ खुनु फ्रेञ्च सुडानं सेनेगलनाप जाना माली गणराज्य mali federation)या पलिस्था यात। अगस्ट २० सन् २९६० खुनु सेनेगलं गणराज्य त्वते धुंका गणराज्य क्वचाल व सेप्टेम्बर २२ खुनु स्वतन्त्र गणतन्त्र मालीया पलिस्था जुल।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: पश्चिमी अफ्रिकाया भूपरिवेष्ठित थ्व देय्‌ हलिमया २४गु दक्ले तःधंगु देय्‌ ख। थनया मौसम ताहान्वइगु व आद्र दु। थनया बुँ आपालं समथर जु व उत्तरी भागय् मरुभूमि ला। देय्‌या तःधंगु भाग दक्षिणी सहाराय् ला। थ्व थासय् पुइगु धु दूगु हर्माटन हेज harmattan haze आपालं सुक्खा मौसमय् खने दु। अडरार देस इफोघास adrar des ifoghas उत्तर पूर्वी क्षेत्रय् ला गन यक्व चिधंगु वादी व ग्रेनाइटया गुं दु। थ्व देशय् यक्व प्राकृतिक सम्पदा दु दसु लुँ युरेनियम फस्फोरस काओलिनाइट चि चून आदिया खानी थ्व देशय् दु।

lines.value: <div style="-moz-column-count:2 column count:2;">
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: elementary algebra is the most basic form of algebra
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it is taught to students who are presumed to have no knowledge of mathematics beyond the basic principles of arithmetic
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in arithmetic only numbers and their arithmetical operations such as + − x ÷ occur
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in algebra numbers are often denoted by symbols such as a x or y
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is useful because
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a polynomial is an expression that is constructed from one or more variables and constants using only the operations of addition subtraction and multiplication where repeated multiplication of the same variable is standardly denoted as exponentiation with a constant whole number exponent
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example x 2 + 2x − 3 is a polynomial in the single variable x an important class of problems in algebra is factorization of polynomials that is expressing a given polynomial as a product of other polynomials
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the example polynomial above can be factored as x − 1)(x + 3
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a related class of problems is finding algebraic expressions for the roots of a polynomial in a single variable
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: abstract algebra extends the familiar concepts found in elementary algebra and arithmetic of numbers to more general concepts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: सेट rather than just considering the different types of numbers abstract algebra deals with the more general concept of sets a collection of all objects called elements selected by property specific for the set
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all collections of the familiar types of numbers are sets
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: other examples of sets include the set of all two by two matrices the set of all second degree polynomials ax 2 + bx + c the set of all two dimensional vectors in the plane and the various finite groups such as the cyclic groups which are the group of integers modulo n set theory is a branch of logic and not technically a branch of algebra
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: बाइनरी अपरेसन the notion of addition + is abstracted to give a binary operation ∗ say
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the notion of binary operation is meaningless without the set on which the operation is defined
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for two elements a and b in a set s a ∗ b is another element in the set this condition is called closure
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: addition + subtraction - multiplication x and division ÷ can be binary operations when defined on different sets as is addition and multiplication of matrices vectors and polynomials
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: identity elements the numbers zero and one are abstracted to give the notion of an identity element for an operation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: zero is the identity element for addition and one is the identity element for multiplication
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for a general binary operator ∗ the identity element e must satisfy a ∗ e = a and e ∗ a = a this holds for addition as a + 0 = a and 0 + a = a and multiplication a x 1 = a and 1 x a = a however if we take the positive natural numbers and addition there is no identity element
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: inverse elements the negative numbers give rise to the concept of inverse elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for addition the inverse of a is −a and for multiplication the inverse is 1/a
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a general inverse element a −1 must satisfy the property that a ∗ a −1 = e and a −1 ∗ a = e associativity addition of integers has a property called associativity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: that is the grouping of the numbers to be added does not affect the sum
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example 1=(2 + 3 + 4 = 2 + 3 + 4
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in general this becomes a ∗ b ∗ c = a ∗ b ∗ c
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this property is shared by most binary operations but not subtraction or division or octonion multiplication
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: commutativity addition of integers also has a property called commutativity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: that is the order of the numbers to be added does not affect the sum
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example 2+3=3+2
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in general this becomes a ∗ b = b ∗ a only some binary operations have this property
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it holds for the integers with addition and multiplication but it does not hold for matrix multiplication or quaternion multiplication
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: combining the above concepts gives one of the most important structures in mathematics a group
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a group is a combination of a set s and a single binary operation ∗ defined in any way you choose but with the following properties for example the set of integers under the operation of addition is a group
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in this group the identity element is 0 and the inverse of any element a is its negation −a
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the associativity requirement is met because for any integers a b and c a + b + c = a + b + c the nonzero rational numbers form a group under multiplication
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: here the identity element is 1 since 1 x a = a x 1 = a for any rational number a the inverse of a is 1/a since a x 1/a = 1
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the integers under the multiplication operation however do not form a group
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is because in general the multiplicative inverse of an integer is not an integer
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example 4 is an integer but its multiplicative inverse is &frac14 which is not an integer
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the theory of groups is studied in group theory
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a major result in this theory is the classification of finite simple groups mostly published between about 1955 and 1983 which is thought to classify all of the finite simple groups into roughly 30 basic types
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: semigroups quasigroups and monoids are structures similar to groups but more general
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: they comprise a set and a closed binary operation but do not necessarily satisfy the other conditions
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a semigroup has an associative binary operation but might not have an identity element
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a monoid is a semigroup which does have an identity but might not have an inverse for every element
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a quasigroup satisfies a requirement that any element can be turned into any other by a unique pre or post operation however the binary operation might not be associative
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all groups are monoids and all monoids are semigroups
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: groups just have one binary operation
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: to fully explain the behaviour of the different types of numbers structures with two operators need to be studied
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most important of these are rings and fields
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: distributivity generalised the distributive law for numbers and specifies the order in which the operators should be applied called the precedence
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for the integers 1=(a + b x c = a x c + b x c and 1=c x a + b = c x a + c x b and x is said to be distributive over +
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a ring has two binary operations + and x with x distributive over +
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: under the first operator + it forms an abelian group
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: under the second operator x it is associative but it does not need to have identity or inverse so division is not allowed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the additive + identity element is written as 0 and the additive inverse of a is written as −a
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the integers are an example of a ring
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the integers have additional properties which make it an integral domain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a field is a ring with the additional property that all the elements excluding 0 form an abelian group under x
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the multiplicative x identity is written as 1 and the multiplicative inverse of a is written as a −1
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the rational numbers the real numbers and the complex numbers are all examples of fields
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the word algebra is also used for various algebraic structures
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: एल्बानी संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया न्यु यर्क राज्यया राजधानी ख। नापं थ्व नगर एल्बानी काउन्तिया मुख्यालय नं ख। थ्व नगर न्यु यर्क सिति स्वया करिब १४० माइल उत्तरय् ला। एल्बानी हद्सन खुसिया सिथय् मोहःक खुसि स्वया करिब १० माइल दक्षिणय् ला। सन् २०१०या तथ्याङ्क कथं थ्व नगरया सकल जनसंख्या ९७,८५६ दु। एल्बानीया नापं दूगु नगर त्रोय schenectady व saratoga springs नाप एल्बानीया क्वातुगु स्वापू दु। थ्व नगरत नापं जाना एल्बानीं क्यापितल दिस्त्रिक्त धाःगु क्षेत्र दयेकु। थ्व क्षेत्रया मू लागा albany schenectady troy महानगर क्षेत्रय् ला। थ्व महानगरया सन् २०१०या जनसंख्या ८,७०,७१६ दु। थ्व जनसंख्या न्यु यर्कया ४गु दकलय् अप्वगु व संरा अमेरिकाया ५८गु दकलय् अप्वगु नगरी जनसंख्या ख।

lines.value: थोमस जेफरसन वा तमस् जेफर्सन अमेरिकाया पलिस्थामि फाउन्दिङ्ग फादर founding father)य् छम्ह व अमेरिकी स्वतन्त्रताया घोषणा declaration of independence)या मू च्वमि ख। वय्‌कलं लिपा संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाया ३म्हम राष्ट्रपतिया रुपय् सन् १८०१ निसें सन् १८०९तक पदभार कयादिल। वय्‌कः राष्ट्रपति जन एदम्स्‌या कार्यकालय् सन् १७९७ निसें सन् १८०१ तक उप-राष्ट्रपतिया रुपय् नं ज्या यानादिल। लोकतन्त्र गणतन्त्र व नागरिक स्वतन्त्रताया प्रस्तावक जेफर्सनजुं अमेरिकी उपनिवेशतेत बेलायती शासनं मुक्त यासें न्हूगु देय्‌ दयेकीगु झ्वलय् थी-थी दस्तावेज व निर्णय यानादिल। वय्‌कः छम्ह बुंथुवा व बुंज्यामि नं ख।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: युनेस्को united nations educational scientific and cultural organization is a specialized agency of the united nations established in 1945
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: its stated purpose is to contribute to peace and security by promoting international collaboration through education science and culture in order to further universal respect for justice the rule of law and the human rights and fundamental freedoms proclaimed in the un charter
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in total 191 nations belong to unesco
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the organization is based in paris with over 50 field offices and several institutes and offices throughout the world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: most of the field offices are cluster offices covering three or more countries there are also national and regional offices
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: unesco pursues its action through five major programmes education natural sciences social and human sciences culture and communication and information
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: projects sponsored by unesco include literacy technical and teacher training programmes international science programmes the promotion of independent media and freedom of the press regional and cultural history projects the promotion of cultural diversity international cooperation agreements to secure the world cultural and natural heritage and to preserve human rights and attempts to bridge the world wide digital divide
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: three bodies are responsible for policy making governance and day to day administration at unesco the executive board's 58 members are elected by the general conference for staggered four year terms
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the executive board prepares the sessions of the general conference and ensures that its instructions are carried out
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it also discharges other specific mandates assigned to it by the general conference
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the secretariat consists of the director general and his staff and is responsible for the day to day running of the organization
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the director general who serves as the public face of unesco is elected for a renewable four year term by the general conference
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the staff currently numbers some 2100 of whom some two thirds are based in paris with the remaining third spread around the world in unesco's 58 field offices
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the secretariat is divided into various administrative offices and five programme sectors that reflect the organization's major areas of focus
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: दुगु च्वलय् मिसाम्ह दुगु व दुगुचा मचाम्ह दुगु capra aegagrus hircus एसिया व युरोपय् गृहस्थीकरण यानातःगु छगू प्रकारया चौपाया ख। थ्व प्राणी बोविदे परिवारया दुने ला। थ्व प्राणी फइ नापं उपपरिवार caprinaeया दुने ला। हलिमय् दुगुया ३०० स्वया अक्व प्रकार दु। दुगु दकलय् न्हापा गृहस्थीकरण याःगु प्राणीइ छगू ख। थुकियात दुरु ला सं छ्यंगु आदिया निंतिं गृहस्थीकरण याःगु ख।
