lines.value: 450px|thumbnail|right|पिरियोडिक टेबलय् रसायनिक तत्त्वत
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: adding to the four elements of the greek philosopher empedocles in about 350 bc aristotle also used the term element and conceived of a fifth element called quintessence which formed the heavens
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: aristotle defined an element as building on this theory in c 790 arabian chemist jabir ibn hayyan geber postulated that metals were formed out of two elements sulphur the stone which burns which characterized the principle of combustibility and mercury which contained the idealized principle of metallic properties
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: shortly thereafter this evolved into the arabic concept of the three principles sulphur giving flammability or combustion mercury giving volatility and stability and salt giving solidity
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1524 swiss chemist paracelsus adopted aristotle's four element theory but reasoned that they appeared in bodies as geber's three principles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: paracelsus saw these principles as fundamental and justified them by recourse to the description of how wood burns in fire
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: mercury included the cohesive principle so that when it left in smoke the wood fell apart
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: smoke represented the volatility the mercury principle the heat giving flames represented flammability sulphur and the remnant ash represented solidity salt
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1669 german physician and chemist johann becher published his physica subterranea in which in modification on the ideas of paracelsus he argued that the constituents of bodies are air water and three types of earth terra fluida the mercurial element which contributes fluidity and volatility terra lapida the solidifying element which produces fusibility or the binding quality and terra pinguis the fatty element which gives material substance its oily and combustible qualities
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these three earths correspond with geber's three principles
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: a piece of wood for example according to becher is composed of ash and terra pinguis when the wood is burnt the terra pinguis is released leaving the ash
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in other words in combustion the fatty earth burns away
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1661 robert boyle showed that there were more than just four classical elements as the ancients had assumed
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first modern list of chemical elements was given in antoine lavoisier's 1789 elements of chemistry which contained thirty three elements including light and caloric
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by 1818 jons jakob berzelius had determined atomic weights for forty five of the forty nine accepted elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1869 in mendeleev's famous periodic table shown below there were sixty six elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: 300px|thumbnail|center|mendeleev's 1869 periodic table from boyle until the early 20th century an element was defined as a pure substance that cannot be decomposed into any simpler substance
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: said another way an element cannot be transformed into other chemical substances by chemical processes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1913 henry moseley discovered that the physical basis of the atomic number of the atom was its nuclear charge which eventually led to the current definition
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the current definition also avoids some ambiguities due to isotopes and allotropes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: by 1919 there were seventy two known elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in 1955 element 101 was discovered and named mendelevium in honor of mendeleev the first to arrange the elements in a periodic manner
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in october 2006 the synthesis of element 118 was reported however element 117 has not yet been created in the laboratory
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the lightest elements are hydrogen and helium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all the heavier elements are made both naturally and artificially through various methods of nucleosynthesis including occasionally nuclear fission
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: as of 2006 there are 117 known elements in this context known means observed well enough even from just a few decay products to have been differentiated from any other element
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: of these 117 elements 94 occur naturally on earth
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: six of these occur in extreme trace quantities technetium atomic number 43 promethium number 61 astatine number 85 francium number 87 neptunium number 93 and plutonium number 94
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these 94 elements and also possibly element 98 californium have been detected in the universe at large in the spectra of stars and also supernovae where short lived radioactive elements are newly being made
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the remaining 22 elements not found on earth or in astronomical spectra have been derived artificially
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: all of the solely artificially derived elements are radioactive with very short half lives if any atoms of these elements were present at the formation of earth they are extremely likely to have already decayed and if present in novae have are in quantities too small to have been noted
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: technetium was the first purportedly non naturally occurring element to be synthesized in 1937 although trace amounts of technetium have since been found in nature and the element may have been discovered naturally in 1925
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this pattern of artificial production and later natural discovery has been repeated with several other radioactive naturally occurring trace elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: lists of the elements by name by symbol by atomic number by density by melting point and by boiling point as well as ionization energies of the elements are available
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the most convenient presentation of the elements is in the periodic table which groups elements with similar chemical properties together
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: छगु तत्त्वया आणविक ल्याखँ थुकिलि दैगु प्रोटोनया ल्या बराबर जुइ। दसु सकल कार्बोन अणुया आणविक न्युक्लियसय् ६गः प्रोटोन दै अथे जुगुलिं कार्बोनया आणविक ल्याखँ z)=६ ख। थन्यागु अणुय् न्युट्रोनया ल्याखं पाय्‌फु थथे न्युट्रोनया ल्याखँ पागु अणुतेत आइसोटोप धाइ।
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the mass number of an element a is the number of nucleons protons and neutrons in the atomic nucleus
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: different isotopes of a given element are distinguished by their mass numbers which are conventionally written as a super index on the left hand side of the atomic symbol e.g 238 u).the relative atomic mass of an element is the average of the atomic masses of all the chemical element's isotopes as found in a particular environment weighted by isotopic abundance relative to the atomic mass unit u
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this number may be a fraction which is not close to a whole number due to the averaging process
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: on the other hand the atomic mass of a pure isotope is quite close to its mass number
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: whereas the mass number is a natural or whole number the atomic mass of a single isotope is a real number which is close to a natural number which in general differs slightly from the mass number because the mass of the protons and neutrons is not exactly 1 u because the electrons also contribute slightly to the atomic mass and because of the nuclear binding energy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example the mass of 19 f is 18.9984032 u the only exception to the atomic mass of an isotope not being a natural number is 12 c which has a mass of exactly 12 due to the definition of u it is fixed as 1/12th of the mass of a free carbon 12 atom exactly
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some isotopes are radioactive and decay into other elements upon radiating an alpha or beta particle
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: certain elements have no nonradioactive isotopes specifically the elements without any stable isotopes are technetium atomic number 43 promethium atomic number 61 and all observed elements with atomic numbers greater than 82
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: some elements can be found as multiple elementary substances known as allotropes which differ in their structure and properties
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example carbon can be found as diamond which has a tetrahedral structure around each carbon atom graphite which has layers of carbon atoms with a hexagonal structure and fullerenes which have nearly spherical shapes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the standard state or reference state of an element is defined as its thermodynamically most stable state at 1 bar at a given temperature typically at 298.15 k
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in thermochemistry an element is defined to have an enthalpy of formation of zero in its standard state
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example the reference state for carbon is graphite because it is more stable than the other allotropes
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the naming of elements precedes the atomic theory of matter although at the time it was not known which chemicals were elements and which compounds
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: when it was learned existing names e.g gold mercury iron were kept in most countries and national differences emerged over the names of elements either for convenience linguistic niceties or nationalism
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example the germans use wasserstoff for hydrogen and sauerstoff for oxygen while english and some romance languages use sodium for natrium and potassium for kalium and the french greeks and poles prefer azote azot for nitrogen
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but for international trade the official names of the chemical elements both ancient and recent are decided by the international union of pure and applied chemistry which has decided on a sort of international english language
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: that organization has recently prescribed that aluminium and caesium take the place of the us spellings aluminum and cesium while the us sulfur takes the place of the british sulphur
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: but chemicals which are practicable to be sold in bulk within many countries however still have national names and those which do not use the latin alphabet cannot be expected to use the iupac name
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: according to iupac the full name of an element is not capitalized even if it is derived from a proper noun such as the elements californium or einsteinium unless it would be capitalized by some other rule
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: isotopes of chemical elements are also uncapitalized if written out carbon 12 or uranium 235
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in the second half of the twentieth century physics laboratories became able to produce nuclei of chemical elements that have a half life too short for them to remain in any appreciable amounts
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these are also named by iupac which generally adopts the name chosen by the discoverer
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this can lead to the controversial question of which research group actually discovered an element a question which delayed the naming of elements with atomic number of 104 and higher for a considerable time
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: see element naming controversy
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: precursors of such controversies involved the nationalistic namings of elements in the late nineteenth century
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example lutetium was named in reference to paris france
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the germans were reluctant to relinquish naming rights to the french often calling it cassiopeium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the british discoverer of niobium originally named it columbium in reference to the new world
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: it was used extensively as such by american publications prior to international standardization
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: before chemistry became a science alchemists had designed arcane symbols for both metals and common compounds
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these were however used as abbreviations in diagrams or procedures there was no concept of atoms combining to form molecules
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: with his advances in the atomic theory of matter john dalton devised his own simpler symbols based on circles which were to be used to depict molecules
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the current system of chemical notation was invented by berzelius
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: in this typographical system chemical symbols are not used as mere abbreviations though each consists of letters of the latin alphabet they are symbols intended to be used by peoples of all languages and alphabets
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first of these symbols were intended to be fully universal since latin was the common language of science at that time they were abbreviations based on the latin names of metals fe comes from ferrum ag from argentum
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the symbols were not followed by a period full stop as abbreviations were
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: later chemical elements were also assigned unique chemical symbols based on the name of the element but not necessarily in english
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example sodium has the chemical symbol na after the latin natrium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the same applies to w wolfram for tungsten hg hydrargyrum for mercury k kalium for potassium au aurum for gold pb plumbum for lead and sb stibium for antimony
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: chemical symbols are understood internationally when element names might need to be translated
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are sometimes differences for example the germans have used j instead of i for iodine so the character would not be confused with a roman numeral
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the first letter of a chemical symbol is always capitalized as in the preceding examples and the subsequent letters if any are always lower case small letters
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: there are also symbols for series of chemical elements for comparative formulas
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: these are one capital letter in length and the letters are reserved so they are not permitted to be given for the names of specific elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: for example an x is used to indicate a variable group amongst a class of compounds though usually a halogen while r is used for a radical meaning a compound structure such as a hydrocarbon chain
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the letter q is reserved for heat in a chemical reaction
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: y is also often used as a general chemical symbol although it is also the symbol of yttrium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: z is also frequently used as a general variable group
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: l is used to represent a general ligand in inorganic and organometallic chemistry
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: m is also often used in place of a general metal
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the three main isotopes of the element hydrogen are often written as h for protium d for deuterium and t for tritium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: this is in order to make it easier to use them in chemical equations as it replaces the need to write out the mass number for each atom
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: थ्व थे याना च्वै:d २ o हेभी वाटर 2 h २ o
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: during the early phases of the big bang nucleosynthesis of hydrogen nuclei resulted in the production of hydrogen and helium isotopes as well as very minuscule amounts on the order of 10 -10 ) of lithium and beryllium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: no heavier elements were produced
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: as a result the primordial abundance of atoms consisted of roughly 75% 1 h 25% 4 he and 0.01% deuterium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: subsequent enrichment of galactic halos occurred due to stellar nucleosynthesis and supernova nucleosynthesis
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: however intergalactic space can still closely resemble the primordial abundance unless it has been enriched by some means
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the following table shows the ten most common elements in our galaxy estimated spectroscopically as measured in parts per million by mass
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: nearby galaxies that have evolved along similar lines have a corresponding enrichment of elements heavier than hydrogen and helium
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: the more distant galaxies are being viewed as they appeared in the past so their abundances of elements appear closer to the primordial mixture
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: as physical laws and processes appear common throughout the visible universe however it is expected that these galaxies will likewise have evolved similar abundances of elements
lines.name: Newar

lines.value: मिसिसिपी छगू सं रा अमेरिकाया राज्य ख। थ्व राज्य दक्षिणी संयुक्त राज्यय् ला। थ्व राज्यया राजधानी व दकले तःधंगु नगर ज्याक्सन ख। थ्व राज्यया नां मिसिसिपी खुसिया नामं वःगु ख। थ्व खुसि थ्व राज्यया पश्चिमी सीमानां बाहावं। मिसिसिपी खँग्वः एनिशिनाबे भाषाया खँग्वः misi ziibi मिसि-जिब्बी नं वःगु ख गुकिया अर्थ तःधंगु खुसि ख। थ्व राज्यय् यक्व जंगल दु। मिसिसिपी देल्ता क्षेत्रय् धाःसा जंगल फडानी याना कपाय्या खेति १९गु शताब्दी निसें न्ह्यथंगु दु। वर्तमानय् थ्व राज्यया क्याटफिश लहिनेज्यां संरा अमेरिकाया दकले अप्व क्याटफिश उत्पादन या।

lines.value: रुथेनियम छगू रसायनिक तत्त्व ख। थ्व तत्त्वया चिं ru व एतमिक ल्या ४४ ख। थ्व छगू दुर्लभ संक्रमण धातु rare transition metal ख। थ्व धातु तत्त्वमांय् प्लातिनम पुचलय् ला। प्लातिनम पुचःया मेमेगु धातु थें हे रुथेनियम धातुं नं आपा रसायननाप प्रतिकृया याइमखु। थ्व तत्त्वया खोज कार्म अर्न्स्त क्लाउसं सन् १८४४स केजन राज्य विश्वविद्यालयय्(kazan state university यानादीगु ख। रुथेनियम आपालं प्लातिनमया खानीइ गौणतत्त्वया रुपय् दयाच्वनि। आपा रुथेनियमयात इलेक्त्रिकल ज्याभलय् व थिक-फिल्म रेजिस्तरय् छ्येलीगु या। थुकियात प्लातिनम मिस्रधातुइ रसायनिक क्यातालिस्तया रुपय् नं छ्येलीगु या।

lines.value: तल्मुद यहुदी धर्मया ग्रन्थ ख। थ्व ग्रन्थ रब्बाइनिक यहुदी धर्मया दकलय् केन्द्रिय ग्रन्थ ख। थुकियात परम्परागत रुपय् शास shas वा ש״ס धका नं म्हसीकिगु या। शास धाःगु शिशा सेदारिम shisha sedarim)या चीहाकःगु रुप ख। शिशा सेदारिमया अर्थ खुता आदेश ख। साधारण कथं तल्मुद धकाः म्हसीकिगु ग्रन्थ बेबिलोनियन तल्मुद ख। थ्व स्वया न्हापाया संस्करण जेरुसालेम तल्मुद धैगु ग्रन्थ नं दु। तल्मुदय् निता भाग दु। थुकिया न्हापाया भाग मिश्नाः mishnah वा משנה ख। मिश्नाःय् रब्बाइनिक यहुदी धर्मया मौखिक परम्पराय् आधारित खँयात संक्षिप्तय् च्वयातःगु दु। तल्मुदया लिपांगु भाग गेमारा gemara ख गुकिलि मिश्नाःय् च्वयातःगु खँया विस्तारित वर्णन दु। तल्मुद धाःगु खँग्वःयात मिश्नाः जक्क वा मिश्नाः व गेमारा नितां थुइकेत छ्येलिगु या। सकल तल्मुदय् ६३पु आलेख दु। सामान्य कथं ध्वानातःगु प्रतिइ थ्व सकल आलेख करिब ६,२०० पौस दयाच्वनि। थ्व ग्रन्थ तनाइतिक हिब्रु tannaitic hebrew व अरामाइक aramaic भासय् च्वयातःगु दु। तल्मुदय् द्वलंद्व रब्बाइतेगु थीथी विषयय् विचाः व शिक्षा मुंकातःगु दु। थ्व ग्रन्थय् मुंकातःगु विषयय् हलख halakha विधान यहुदी आचार jewish ethics दर्शन चलन इतिहास विद्या आदि विषय दु। तल्मुद सकल यहुदी विधि-विधानया आधार ख व दकलय् यक्व उद्धरण जुइगु रब्बाइनिक ग्रन्थ नं ख।

lines.value: जीवशास्त्र छगु एकिकृत विज्ञानया कथं दक्ले न्ह्य १९औं शताब्दीय् वगु ख। थ्व इले वैज्ञानिकतेसं सकल प्राणीतेगु छुं आधारभूत खं मिलेजुगु व थ्व आधारभूत खं नापं सीकुसा अपुइगु खं सीकल। थौं जीवशास्त्र छगु स्तरीय विषय जुगु दु। थ्व विषय ब्वंकुथि विश्वविद्यालय आदि थासय् ब्वंकिगु जु। नापं थ्व विषयय् लखौं-लख मालेज्या-पौ research paper नं ध्वाय्‌गु या।
lines.name: Newar
